intro: Knautia integrifolia var. bidens, commonly known as the two-toothed knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. The species is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
